description.value: artist who participates in performing arts in front of an audience: actors, comedians, dancers, magicians, circus artists, musicians, singers

annotation_type.label: timbre
annotation_type.description: quality of a musical note or sound or tone

annotation_type.label: con sordina
annotation_type.description: device fitted to a musical instrument to alter the sound produced

annotation_type.label: pedal keyboard
annotation_type.description: musical keyboard played with the feet, usually used for low-pitched notes

annotation_type.label: fingering
annotation_type.description: choice of which fingers and hand positions to use when playing certain musical instruments

annotation_type.label: custos
annotation_type.description: musical symbol at the end of a musical staff, analogous in fuction to a catchword

annotation_type.label: ossia
annotation_type.description: musical term

annotation_type.label: underline
annotation_type.description: horizontal line immediately below a portion of writing

annotation_type.label: brackets
annotation_type.description: tall punctuation mark typically used in matched pairs within text, to set apart or interject other text; opening and closing, or left and right symbols

annotation_type.label: chronometry
annotation_type.description: specifying measures of time-mesaurement in clear reference units

annotation_type.label: solmization
annotation_type.description: system associating syllables to musical notes

annotation_type.label: figured bass
annotation_type.description: musical notation in which numerals/accidentals show chords to be played in relation to the bass note, used in Baroque music

annotation_type.label: chord symbol
annotation_type.description: system for naming chords

annotation_type.label: arpeggio
annotation_type.description: notes in a chord played in sequence

annotation_type.label: breath mark
annotation_type.description: music symbol

annotation_type.label: echo
annotation_type.description: reflection of sound that arrives at the listener with a delay after the direct sound

annotation_type.label: affect
annotation_type.description: experience of feeling or emotion

annotation_type.label: trill
annotation_type.description: musical ornament consisting of a rapid alternation between two adjacent notes, usually a semitone or tone apart

annotation_type.label: mordent
annotation_type.description: musical ornament, consisting of a single alternation with the note above or below

annotation_type.label: turn
annotation_type.description: musical ornament

annotation_type.label: appoggiatura
annotation_type.description: Musical ornament

annotation_type.label: double appoggiatura
annotation_type.description: musical ornament

annotation_type.label: glissando
annotation_type.description: glide from one pitch to another

annotation_type.label: transliteration
annotation_type.description: conversion of a text from one script to another

annotation_type.label: crescendo
annotation_type.description: musical term indicating a gradual increase in dynamic strength

annotation_type.label: decrescendo
annotation_type.description: Musical term indicating a gradual decrease in dynamic strength

annotation_type.label: diminuendo
annotation_type.description: Musical term indicating a gradual decrease in dynamic strength

annotation_type.label: metronome mark
annotation_type.description: musical notation indicating the tempo of a piece in a objective manner

annotation_type.label: ritenuto
annotation_type.description: indication of tempo

annotation_type.label: tenuto
annotation_type.description: articulation

annotation_type.label: pizzicato
annotation_type.description: manner of articulation

annotation_type.label: string harmonic
annotation_type.description: string instrument technique

annotation_type.label: bowing
annotation_type.description: a way of producing sound (articulation) on stringed instruments using a bow

annotation_type.label: engage pedal
annotation_type.description: musical symbol indicating the player to put the sustain pedal down

annotation_type.label: release pedal
annotation_type.description: musical symbol indicating the player to put the sustain pedal down

annotation_type.label: portato
annotation_type.description: form of musical articulation

annotation_type.label: signature
annotation_type.description: handwritten mark made as a proof of identity and intent

annotation_type.label: slur
annotation_type.description: symbol in musical notation

annotation_type.label: ad libitum
annotation_type.description: Latin expression for "at one's pleasure"

annotation_type.label: natural sign
annotation_type.description: musical sign (accidental) cancelling previous accidentals returning the frequency of the note to the natural/original value

annotation_type.label: clef
annotation_type.description: musical symbol used to indicate the pitch of written notes

annotation_type.label: loudness
annotation_type.description: subjective perception of sound pressure

annotation_type.label: articulation
annotation_type.description: musical performance technique that affects the transition or continuity on notes

annotation_type.label: accent
annotation_type.description: emphasis placed on a particular musical note

annotation_type.label: staccato
annotation_type.description: form of musical articulation

annotation_type.label: legato
annotation_type.description: indicates that musical notes are played or sung smoothly and connected

annotation_type.label: flat sign
annotation_type.description: musical sign (accidental) lowering the pitch of a note by one chromatic semitone (factor 2^(1/12))

annotation_type.label: sharp sign
annotation_type.description: musical sign (accidental) raising the pitch of a note by one chromatic semitone (factor 2^(1/12))

annotation_type.label: realization of figured bass
annotation_type.description: practice of expanding figured bass notation into a full accompaniment

annotation_type.label: variation
annotation_type.description: spontaneous or deliberate alteration of information sequences or properties

annotation_type.label: transposition
annotation_type.description: operation in music of moving multiple notes by the same interval

annotation_type.label: colla parte
annotation_type.description: Musical indication to play another, written-out part, or to an accompanist to look to the main part for guidance on tempo

annotation_type.label: cadenza
annotation_type.description: improvised or written-out ornamental passage played or sung by a soloist or soloists

annotation_type.label: tremolo
annotation_type.description: musical term for rapid repetition of a note

annotation_type.label: ornament
annotation_type.description: musical flourishes that are not necessary to carry the overall line of the melody (or harmony), but serve instead to decorate or "ornament" that line

annotation_type.label: messa di voce
annotation_type.description: Singing technique

annotation_type.label: vibrato
annotation_type.description: regular, pulsating change of pitch in music

annotation_type.label: marcato
annotation_type.description: musical instruction

annotation_type.label: octave sign
annotation_type.description: Music symbol referring to a phrase or a section of music to be played one octave higher

annotation_type.label: musical phrasing
annotation_type.description: unit of musical meter that has a complete musical sense of its own

annotation_type.label: string number (sul X)
annotation_type.description: string or wire that vibrates in a string instrument to produce a musical tone

annotation_type.label: musical expression
annotation_type.description: various techniques used in musical performance to convey emotion

annotation_type.label: organ stop
annotation_type.description: part of a pipe organ

annotation_type.label: tempo rubato
annotation_type.description: Musical term

annotation_type.label: portamento
annotation_type.description: pitch sliding from one note to another

annotation_type.label: da capo
annotation_type.description: musical term

annotation_type.label: buff stop
annotation_type.description: stop on harpsichord

annotation_type.label: musical instrument part
annotation_type.description: component used in the construction of a musical instrument

annotation_type.label: translation
annotation_type.description: transfer of the meaning of something in one language into another

annotation_type.label: performance practice
annotation_type.description: study of the performance of music

agent.label: Leo De Barse
agent.description: Belgian horn player and music teacher
